results.title: The King: Wayne Carey
results.creator_credit: Stephen Phillips and Visual Entertainment Group
results.brief_description: There is no more influential or imposing figure in football today than the Kangaroos captain; Wayne Carey. Voted as the greatest player of the twentieth century by Leigh Matthews, Carey has stamped his mark as the dominant centre half forward of his era in over 200 games. All Australian captain, quadruple club champion, leading goalkicker, Carey has earned himself the worthy reputation of “King”. In this program Carey reflects on the memorable moments of his career, there are also revealing interviews with coach Denis Pagan as well as team mates and opponents.

results.creator_credit: Strategic Studies Group and Red Orb Entertainment
results.material_description: CD-ROM videogame. CD-ROM, CD jewel case, advert, registration card, troubleshooting guide and manual in cardboard box
results.brief_description: A stand-alone expansion to Warlords III: Reign of Heroes, Warlords III: Darklords Rising adds new campaigns and scenarios, an enhanced random map generator, and more heroes, units, and spells. Gameplay has also been changed to allow for simultaneous movements, a first in the series.

results.title: The Killing of Sister George
results.creator_credit: Robert Aldrich, Associates and Aldrich Company and Palomar Pictures
results.brief_description: The erosion of a longtime lesbian affair between a television star (Beryl Reid) who plays the role of “Sister George”, the bleeding heart heroine on a British TV soap opera, and her younger lover (Susannah York). The breakup of the relationship comes about when a broadcast executive who fancies the younger woman decides to write Reid out of her key TV role. The basic thrust of the plot is the gradual development of a rapport and sympathy with Reid, in inverse ratio to the loss of respect for York. The film received an X rating on its release due to a controversial five-minute lesbian love scene. Director Robert Aldrich achieved the look and feel of a “Made in Britain” picture, although most of it was shot near downtown LA. Cast also includes Carol Browne, Ronald Fraser, Patricia Medina and Hugh Paddick. Screenplay by Lukas Heller from the play by Frank Marcus.

results.title: Emulation of Team Fortress for PC
results.creator_credit: Ian Caughley, John Cook, Robin Walker and Team Fortress Software
results.brief_description:
Team Fortress is a team and class-based multiplayer online first-person shooter video game mod based on id Software’s Quake Engine. The game has two teams battling it out in game modes like territorial control, capture the flag and escorting a VIP. A high degree of teamwork and cooperation is required to achieve these goals. This is embodied by the game’s class system. A player has a choice of nine different classes to play, each with its own strengths, weaknesses and skills that complement the other classes.

Due to its success, the developers were hired by Valve to mod it for their own game, Half-Life. This eventually led to a series of tweaks, enhancements and additions to the base game, eventually releasing as a standalone version titled Team Fortress Classic.

results.title: The Journey = The Voyage = El Viaje [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Fernando Solanas, Djamila Olivesi, Envar El Kadri, Cinesur and Les Films du Sud
results.brief_description: Argentinian born director Fernando Solanas began his career making short films and documentaries of a political nature before eventually seeking exile in France in 1977 after the military coup in Argentina in 1976. In 1985, he received international renown with “Tangos: the exile of Gardel” which was awarded the Special Prize of the Jury in Venice. “The Journey” (aka “The Voyage”) continues the strong political theme, albeit in a somewhat satirical way. The plot centres around 17 year-old Martin (Walter Quiroz) who sets out on his bicycle to find his long lost father, an anthropologist who was last reported as working in Brazil. His epic journey from Tierra del Fuego to Peru, the Andes highlands to the Amazon and finally to Brazil proves to be a life-changing, mind-opening experience revealing the political exploitation, environmental and cultural destruction and the sometimes absurd contradictions which exist in this unique and precious part of the world known as Latin America. Cast also includes Franklin Caicedo, Fito Paez, Carlos Carella, Ricardo Bartis, Angela Correa. In Spanish with English subtitles.

results.title: The Kid; Three men in a tub
results.brief_description: In “the Kid”, Chaplin is less of the buffoon and more of the actor but his comedy is ever present and there is not a dull moment once the comedian comes into the picture. Introduced as “a picture with a smile - perhaps a tear”, it proves to be just that. For while it will move people to uproarious laughter and keep them in a state of uneasing delight, it will also touch their hearts and win sympathy, not only for the star, but for its leading woman and little Jackie Coogan. The little tramp adopts an abandoned Kid in the slums of early New York city, where only the fittest can survive. There are characteristic “Chaplin touches”. A fine instance of imagination is where he dreams of Heaven. His slum alley is transformed into a bit of paradise, where everybody - including his nemesis, the cop, and a big bully are turned into angels! Includes an episode of those mischievious mites, The Young Rascals, entitled “Three men in a tub”.

results.title: The Kid who couldn't miss
results.creator_credit: Paul Cowan and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The Kid Who Couldn’t Miss has been the subject of controversy since its release in 1982. It is the fascinating account of how a brash kid from Owen Sound, Ontario, named William Avery (Billy) Bishop, became one of the leading fighter pilots of World War I. This film is a docudrama and combines elements of both reality and fiction. It does not pretend to be a biography of Billy Bishop. Certain characters have been used to express certain doubts and reservations about Bishop’s exploits. There is no evidence that these were shared by the actual characters. At age 23, Bishop became a hero and Canada’s most decorated military figure. Excerpts from John Gray’s play Billy Bishop Goes to War, featuring Eric Peterson, provide a thread throughout the film.

results.title: Warlords II for DOS
results.material_description: Floppy disk videogame. Two 3 1/2 inch floppy disks, registration card, subscription card, catalogue, advert, reply paid envelope and manual in cardboard box
results.brief_description: Warlords II refines on the formula that made the previous game so successful. New to the game is the addition of “fog of war”, where enemy units may be concealed from the map if a player’s own units are not close enough to see them. The interface and graphics have been upgraded and a suite of tools have been added to facilitate its multiplayer experience. This include a play by e-mail feature, a random map generator and a map editor.
